item.title: HP has announced a new promotion offering free roaming Wi-Fi for specific notebooks and tablets
item.description: HP and iPass, the largest Wi-Fi network globally, recently revealed a partnership. Select HP laptops and tablets will now offer access to the iPass network. Source: HP website. This collaboration aims to provide users in Asia Pacific and Japan (APJ) with easier and more budget-friendly internet access both locally and during their travels. Customers purchasing new HP laptops and tablets with this feature will enjoy automatic access to millions of hotspots on the iPass network for a year, free of charge, upon registration.

item.title: Singapore customers can test products before making a purchase with Flokk
item.description: Flokk, a Norwegian company known for producing high-quality seating furniture, has joined forces with W. Atelier to introduce Flokk’s brands to the Singapore market. Source: Flokk. HÅG chairs in an office. Flokk is recognized for its ergonomic and sustainable designs, with all products developed, produced, and manufactured in Europe. Each of Flokk’s eight brands represents the highest quality, as demonstrated in W. Atelier’s Henderson showroom, where HÅG, RBM, and RH are exclusively featured.

item.title: Singapore Science Park 1 will be testing a program for sharing personal mobility devices
item.description: Ascendas-Singbridge Group, a leading provider of sustainable urban and business space solutions in Asia, has partnered with Neuron Mobility, a smart transportation solutions provider, to pilot a personal mobility device (PMD) sharing program at Singapore Science Park 1. This six-month trial reflects the group’s commitment to enhancing accessibility and convenience for tenants, employees, and visitors within the park. Starting June 14, 2017, fifty GPS-equipped e-scooters and twenty bicycles will be available for rent at six designated parking zones throughout Singapore Science Park 1.
